intro: Diplotaxis leiocarpa, commonly known as the white-flowered dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant features basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape and are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a dense cluster at the top of the stem. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds dispersed by the wind.
